item.title: Jen add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "One of the great tragedies of mankind is that morality has been hijacked by religion. So now people assume that religion and morality have a necessary connection. But the basis of morality is really very simple and doesn't require religion at all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jen add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Science is the only religion of mankind." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jen add a quote by Arthur C Clarke
item.description: "This is the first age that's ever paid much attention to the future, which is a little ironic since we may not have one." -- Arthur C Clarke

item.title: Jen add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jen add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jen add a quote by Claude Levi-Strauss
item.description: "The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he's one who asks the right questions." -- Claude Levi-Strauss
